bow: becoming the mother to disabled child our story april 2019 was an exciting day the day we would be welcoming our third and final child boy his name had been chosen his brothers were excited for his arrival and his father and beamed with pride in route to the hospital as most inductions go it was long day we waited and waited until it was finally time to meet our boy at 3:40 pm he was here laughed and cried and couldn believe had once again brought beautiful life into this world the normal things happened tests were ran he passed them all and we were sent home after 24 hours as we got home we learned quickly that life with three boys was crazy hectic and that we felt more love than we had ever felt before our puzzle of family was complete with it final piece finally making its way into our home everything was wonderful tiring and exciting he functioned normally for the first three days he ate pooped peed slept repeat it became monotonous but loved every moment of time had with my darling new boy after day became concerned as he was no longer stooling every doctor told me this could be normal in breastfed baby listened it wasn until visit with my lactation consultant who looked him over and said she could hear great bowel sounds and didn see an immediate issue told me about her time as nicu nurse and told me that if he started throwing up feces we had an issue but she wholeheartedly didn believe it would happen as she had seen it once in her 20+ years at 11 days old he threw up bright green then he kept throwing up and he refused to feed immediately contacted his pediatrician and told them our issues they worked us into their schedule immediately after arriving he seemed to get worse the throwing up increased and it became the brightest shade of green have ever seen was terrified his pediatrician seemed concerned but not enough to instill unnecessary fear until she knew for sure what our next steps would be she took us to an ray and told me she was going to call the surgery team at our local children hospital to see if they had suggestions before our ray was done she was in the radiology area telling me we needed to sit and have talk not necessarily what you want to hear about your eleven day old she explained to me that the surgery team thought our son may have bowel obstruction and that we needed to drive to our local hospital for an iv and an ng tube followed by transfer to the children hospital instantly filled with heat couldn even cry whisked him away with out word but as soon as the air from outside hit my face tears came what does this all mean is he going to be okay what wrong with my baby after long drive that seemed to take forever we made it to the children hospital after our short trip to our local they immediately started looking for place to put an iv as his tiny veins were shriveled up and he was extremely dehydrated they took us for barium enemas xrays did blood labs and finally admitted us to the nicu he finally got his iv in the nicu his enema showed radiologists that he had mega colon which is the main sign of disease called hirschsprung the radiologist said it out loud and never realized that it would change my life forever the next day he had bedside rectal biopsy then perc line placed and finally after many attempts at irrigating our dear boy and it failing his biopsy reports came back he was two weeks old when he was diagnosed with hirschsprung disease hirschsprung is defined by missing ganglion cells in the colon and small intestine that make it impossible for stool to come out he was scheduled to surgery to place an ostomy the very next day his surgery started at 1:30 pm he was in for hours before the surgeon came to give us his report our sons entire colon was useless he was then considered total colonic hirschsprung hirschsprungs itself is in 5000 babies born typically males and is considered genetic disease having total colonic hirschsprung made him even more of rarity he handled surgery well we had total of 14 days staying at the children hospital before we went home after returning home things were amazing for about weeks until they weren our boy had an obstruction due to too much scar tissue in his small intestine from the last surgery so now the ileostomy had just gotten used to being on the right side of his belly was now rerouted to his left my life has become constant blur of hospital stays ostomy care and learning the ins and outs of caring for medically needy child love this boy more than words can say he is so very special to me and while he will have an ileostomy likely for the rest of his life and we still haven gotten him to perfect and comfortable place working my hardest to find answers for him tl dr our son was born with genetic intestinal disease called hirschsprung and had his colon removed at two weeks old had an ileostomy placed and ended up having another surgery to reroute his ileostomy weeks later we still don have all the answers but hope to soon this format is super hard to read but wish you the best sorry it is lot to put into words ☹️ no no did meant what you wrote just meant the formatting how you have to scroll over just how it looks is hard to read hmmmm wonder why it did that it looks normal on my app weird am on computer for reference you have to scroll super far to the right to read almost each sentence wow what journey you ve been on with him can begin to imagine how hard that is my little one has allergies were trying to work out ve cut things from my diet and we re dealing with reflux same as with my first baby but on the hard days always say we re lucky there are so many harder things that we might be dealing with sounds like you re doing great job of dealing with this it much be especially hard to find the time for his big brothers too wish you and you re family the very best thank you ♥️ he been teaching me everything never knew about being mother he can tolerate breastfeeding and my other two breastfed for at least 15 months each he has an ileostomy so that is completely new and learning to be your child voice when you re not even sure what wrong is so hard hope you guys find your answers well that annoying it fine on my iphone weird just checked on my iphone and computer and they are the same even cleared my cache idk sorry if it just me you are so strong sorry that you re being forced to watch your little guy go through surgeries at what supposed to be such joyful time make sure to take little time for yourself my son also had hirschsprungs glad they figured it for you so soon it so hard to watch your newborn go through it my friends baby was born with rare genetic disorder always try to be there for her but do know how any suggestions honestly just lending an ear when she needs to vent and not pretending to understand it okay to not understand what she going through if you don go through it yourself it extremely hard to relate if my friends offered to just come over and let me shower or bring meal on occasion would be floored it feels extremely lonely in this position so any extra help is always welcomed at least for me aw thanks for the advice sending you and your family so much love you are strong and clearly an incredible mother am sorry your little one is struggling but it is good to see that he was born into family that loves him and cares of him no matter what ♥️ being mother is by far my favorite thing and while was not prepared for what has happened with him will not stop until have every last answer for his comfort and care he special dude and lucky he mine ❤️i can imagine hang in there you are so strong much love to your precious little bebe you are so strong and so is your sweet little boy wish you all the best on your journey if you need help finding parents of children with similar issue same disease nicuparenting might be good place to start mu daughter has chd and it became great resource to help keep us sane during her hospital stays or to just have people to vent to who have been through the same thing whew mama you ve been on quite ride sending you love as you figure everything out thank you ♥️ we will get there one day one step at time thank you so much it definitely helpful to have people who understand you on your side thank you it definitely far from over but we have luckily switched hospitals and are getting much more answers now just long road of more testing and possible surgeries in the near future ours had fpies which is luckily something they grow out of but do have some ideas we really needed someone to do cleaning our friend came over every other day an cleaned bottles for us it was much but it was everything to us if he have been comfortable holding her getting an hour upstairs away from her would have been so good too bring over food every now and then yeah that what would have wanted everyone is different though so her needs might be different than ours and she might not even know what they are yet just offer to come over and do an activity like dishes or whatever then after you do that see if there anything else that they need you ll find groove with helping if you go over even once week as mama who has had young child endure surgical procedures stand with you and know that some days are going to suck and letting you know that it is okay to not be okay if you can be hope you get more answers for your little love the story is super touching op very impressed with your resilience mother never stops until her children have everything they need to thrive that how it should be at least ♥️ it up to us to create the future we better make it good couldn have said it better my husband had hirschbrungs and had colostomy bag as baby while he does need to use the bathroom more often and has scar he does carry any health problems his mother told me when he was baby how terrified she was but just kept powering through sending you best wishes and speedy recovery lt thank you so much did he have short or long segment would have to ask him we dont talk in detail about it since he obviously does remember it if he gets constipated though definitely keep an eye and try to resolve it quickly know that is one thing we did worry about while my husband was in the army eating mre could ask his mother about it and see if she has advice though it may be dated appreciate it was just curious it insane how some people recover so easily and others struggle lifelong she mentioned that after his colomsty bag was off he would get very bad rashes so if it comes to that to just make him little loin cloth to let it breath she also said to be careful of the stomach flu because it can be much worse on them and that if they throw up with severe stomach ache to take them in because his intestines could twist more easily the stools will most likely always be loose and never solid so that is normal hope this helps some he will never have reversal so he has the bag forever but ve heard the rash from pull thru is knarly this kid is going to give me grey hair early oh am so sorry is there any possibility of transplant later on and as for the grey hair that why they make hair dye swear ve been keeping that business afloat lol nope unfortunately not his colon is gone as is bunch of his small intestine they re assuming he will be considered short gut and they re actually considering feeding tube he just got to work with what he has available that incredibly tough would he need the feeding tube forever as well you are so strong to help him through this even with the difficulties already know he will have great life with loving family it unknown for sure he has to have test done soon called an antroduodenal manometry and it puts scope through his nose stomach intestines and out of his stoma to test motility it will give us more information on likelihood of his feeding issues being forever hoping for the best that an intense journey my oldest daughter has rare genetic disorder it crazy because while you re learning how to navigate life as special needs parent you re also trying to figure out if there anyone else out there going through what you re going through few months after our diagnosis was listening to the moth hour with my husband woman started telling her story about her perfect easy pregnancy and knew just knew something was wrong with her kid it was down syndrome never thought be jealous of mom because their kid had down syndrome but it just kind blowing how much more common it is and how many resources there are they don even realize how lucky they are anyway that my rant hope you re dealing well thank you for sharing this ❤️ thank you for reading 😌🥰 you are such strong mom reading your story brought tears to my eyes dietitian in pediatric gi short bowel syndrome intestinal rehab group and we ve had couple total colonic hirschprungs babies also just had my first son and can only imagine how hard it would be to worry about my child health the way you must worry for your sons my good news to share with you though is how happy and well adjusted my kiddos from clinic are smart and happy just with extra hurdles they ve had to overcome don want to minimize the medical concerns but just wanted to share with you that most of our kids go on to live very full lives and experience all of the joys of childhood don know your baby exact anatomy but often they are even able to reconnect ileostomies once the babies have grown some and have enough bowel to allow for that will keep you guys in my prayers you are such good mom and your son is so lucky you were chosen for him that how feel when people tell me at least it not cancer like oh yes rare genetic disease that no one knows about and no one has funded anything for hardly why wouldn that be better something that incurable 🙄🙄🙄 thank you so much unfortunately our son is possibly considered short gut his reconnect is likely not possible as he has intestinal neuronal dysplasia also and his motility is absolute garbage even through his ileostomy so reconnect to sphincter would be no bueno possibility of feeding tube as he has terrible issues with feeds all in all it has sucked but he honestly one of the happiest babies ve ever met we will get through it one way or another ♥️ hi there so sorry you are going through this special ed teacher and just commenting to say that have little guy who is in 2nd grade who also experiences hirschsprungs and he will have his bag for life he currently has feeding tube right now because his weight goes up and down depending on how his gut is doing that being said do see him because of any intellectual issues just make sure he has the accommodations he needs to function in school and get him caught up if he falls behind due to dr appts and or being sick he out longer than some kids he has his special toileting routines that he goes to the nurse for he has fitbit type watch that vibrates during the day for feedings and the toilet stuff all this being said the props go to his parents they make sure that he has the most normal childhood possible that tube feeding has to happen before lunch so that he can do lunch with his friends his toileting does get in the way of recess or other things his parents make sure that he goes to all the birthday parties he invited to and they make sure he plays the sports he wants to sometimes with accommodations but they are tireless in having him be as normal as possible because of that he does think he has limits he just does stuff his way and it fantastic to watch know these times are stressful because he so small but he has bright future and if you continue to advocate for him in school and beyond like you are now there wo be anything he ca do thank you so much for this ♥️ it is so hard to know what the future might look like but it amazing knowing that there are kids like my son out there and they are thriving because their parents will not rest unless they are this just made me feel so happy an odd feeling but so relieved thank you for sharing your story my heart goes to you and importantly you are not alone my daughter has had bevy of issues since she was born almost exactly one year ago including one so rare ve only found other people in the world with child with the same issue it not life threatening but it will require orthopedic surgery that basically experimental her pediatrician always tells me that this isn the normal amount of work for baby had always planned on more kids it just so exhausting to fight for my baby months and months other moms don understand cry when wish my almost one year old could just drink milk or water like regular baby then quietly go through the process of thickening her milk and putting it into the special pouch she can drink from with help or too worn out from therapy visits and doctors visits to take her to story time or play dates the stay at home moms know struggle to relate to my mess of self and tangle of busy schedules filled with appointments the working moms know think just another sah mom and just tired recently had two emergency surgeries and my husband and mom took over my job even then my daughter had to miss lot of her normal appointments two people can barely manage what did on my own oh am so sorry do know how you feel in saying that it so incredibly lonely on this side of things it such tiring and endless job but sure you feel as do that you would do absolutely anything to make sure your baby has what they need to thrive have two more boys besides this one and man it struggle most days to just pee if you ever need an ear my inbox is open ♥️ ah understand that rough road but so much better to have that ileostomy than constant diaper rash and diarrhea feeding tubes can be scary at first but they can become very normal over time for everyone in the family we have plenty of kids on home tpn too it not common everywhere but if he unable to progress with tubefeeds there are practices that will teach you to care for central line at home even our practice is in dallas area but there are others for sure kids are so amazing with how strong they are things that would harden adults and make us bitter just makes them better always so inspired by our sweet babes know you ve got extra challenges on your road with your son but you ve got this it will be beautiful journey know it all whirl wind right now but stay strong get him into all the early intervention stuff he qualifies for and be insistent that he not miss out on anything just because he has some challenges he going to do great dated guy for long time that had his colon and much of his small intestine removed when he was young due to hirschprungs he almost 40 now he can eat food but does absorb any of the nutrients so he has to go in few times week for infusions through permanent port in his chest he has his struggles and weak days but he lives full life he is married now and an avid hiker hope that your son can be as happy as he is sincerely hope so as well thank you opps wrong link meant nicuparents it because you started the lines with extra spaces reddit reads that as code if you remove them it should look normal plus how insensitive to parents of children with cancer to say at least it not cancer people just do think not at all what was fpies like for you guys my son just barfs lot when he has peanuts omg it was horrifying she was sensitive to the milk protien shape so anything that was milk or turned into milk almond pea breast was her trigger she would vomit periodically but had loose stools 10 times day until she was years old it started to slow down then she was unable to get sufficient nutrients so she stopped physically growing from 10 months it was utterly horrifying during that time and our doctor at the time did not believe anything said by the time got to the new doc and the old took almost two months to send files we basically had to hospitalize her wow that sounds like nightmare am so sorry that all of you had to experience that glad she better now fpies is so uncommon it seems it hasn been big deal for us but don think pediatricians even know what it is when mention it just the allergist who diagnosed it it took us until she was 19 months to even get the right diagnosis it was crazy she had multiple things going on so it was hard to pinpoint poor kiddo is stuck in the 3rd percentile after being in the 50th until symptoms started keep hoping she ll get back into her grove now that she grown out of it but nothing yet
